intro: Hieracium guentheri-beckii, commonly known as the Guenther's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its leaves are basal, rough, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Hieracium guentheri-beckii is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
